marklogic.body: I'm not sure about "elitism" but the other two points in the heading are Spot on: it's harder than ever to recognise the Conservative Party's values (they've been fading away like the Cheshire Cat for many years), and anyone attempting to make sense of its policies will certainly get confused. Why waste more time on it? Resuscitative measures have gone on too long - turn Off the machines, disconnect the tubes, let it die. I have a certain abstract admiration for those dwindling few loyalists who persist in believeing that one last shove can regain Tory greatness, reclaim the Party from its degenerate state, but this is outweighed by pity. England is in a sorry state: who will ride to her rescue? Not the Conservatives, for sure.

target.displayName: From @NadineDorriesMP: People no longer recognise the Conservative Party's values, are confused
